hero_description: Free tools to understand your health better. Calculate your BMI, assess your health risks, and get personalized guidance — all in one place.
tools_description: Use our free tools to get instant insights about your health metrics. No sign-up required, and your data stays on your device.

tool_bp_crisis_description: A reading this high requires emergency care. Please go to the nearest hospital or call emergency services immediately.
tool_bp_invalid_range: The values you entered seem unusually high. Please double-check your reading.
tool_bp_tips_description: Ensure the person has not exercised, had tea/coffee, or used tobacco in the last 30 minutes. Rest comfortably and quietly for 5 minutes before the reading.
tool_sugar_description: Interpret your blood sugar readings (FBS, RBS, PPBS, or HbA1c) instantly.

tool_sugar_note_description: A single reading isn't enough for diagnosis. Diabetes is typically confirmed with two separate tests. Always consult a healthcare provider for proper diagnosis and treatment.

tool_cancer_description: Screen for early warning signs. Early detection saves lives.
tool_cancer_subtitle: Early detection saves lives. Answer honestly — this is for your awareness.
tool_cancer_gender_description: This helps us ask the right questions
tool_cancer_symptoms_description: Have you experienced any of these in the past few months?
tool_cancer_consult_description: You reported one or more symptoms that need medical evaluation. Please consult a doctor at the nearest health facility for further evaluation. Early detection can make a significant difference.
tool_cancer_no_symptoms_description: Consider routine screening once every 5 years. If you notice new symptoms later, consult a health facility promptly.
tool_cancer_breast_exam_subtitle: How to perform a self-breast examination:
tool_cancer_breast_exam_step1: Stand in front of a mirror with shoulders straight and arms on hips
tool_cancer_breast_exam_step2: Look for any changes in size, shape, or color of breasts
tool_cancer_breast_exam_step3: Raise your arms and look for the same changes
tool_cancer_breast_exam_step4: While lying down, use your right hand to feel your left breast and vice versa
tool_cancer_breast_exam_step5: Use firm, smooth touches with finger pads in circular motions
tool_cancer_breast_exam_step6: Cover the entire breast from top to bottom, side to side
tool_cancer_breast_exam_step7: Feel your breasts while standing or sitting, such as in the shower
tool_cancer_breast_exam_note: Seek help if you find a new lump, thickening, or any change. Monthly self-exams help you know what's normal for your body.
tool_cancer_about_description: This tool helps identify potential warning signs that may need medical attention. It is not a diagnosis. Many symptoms can have causes other than cancer. Only a healthcare professional can provide a proper diagnosis.
tool_cancer_cta_description: Take our full assessment for personalized risk scores and guidance.
tool_uhid_description: Get your Unique Health ID for Kerala's digital health system.
tool_uhid_subtitle: Your Unique Health Identifier for Kerala's digital health ecosystem
tool_uhid_what_is_description_1: UHID (Unique Health Identifier) is a unique identification number assigned to every citizen under Kerala's State Digital Health Mission. It serves as your digital health identity across all government healthcare facilities in Kerala.
tool_uhid_what_is_description_2: With UHID, all your health records from government hospitals, PHCs, and health centers are linked together, making healthcare delivery smoother and more efficient.
tool_uhid_benefit_1: Access all your medical records in one place
tool_uhid_benefit_2: Seamless care across Kerala's government hospitals
tool_uhid_benefit_3: Secure and private health data storage
tool_uhid_benefit_4: Easy access through mobile and web portal
tool_uhid_how_to_description: You'll need your Aadhaar number linked with a mobile number
tool_uhid_step_1: Click the button below to visit the eHealth Kerala portal
tool_uhid_step_2: Select 'Create UHID / Link Mobile Number with UHID'
tool_uhid_step_4: Verify using OTP sent to your Aadhaar-linked mobile
tool_uhid_step_5: Confirm your details and your UHID will be generated
tool_uhid_already_have_description: You can use the same portal to log in, view your health records, and manage your profile.
tool_uhid_faq_1_question: What if my mobile isn't linked with Aadhaar?
tool_uhid_faq_1_answer: If your mobile number is not linked with Aadhaar, you can visit the nearest government hospital reception desk to create your UHID with assistance from healthcare staff.
tool_uhid_faq_2_answer: Yes. The State Digital Health Mission follows strict data protection guidelines. Your health records are encrypted and can only be accessed by authorized healthcare providers when you visit a facility.
tool_uhid_faq_3_question: Can I use UHID at private hospitals?
tool_uhid_faq_3_answer: Currently, UHID is primarily used in government healthcare facilities. However, integration with private hospitals is being expanded under the State Digital Health Mission.

tool_jak_description: Locate your nearest Janakeeya Arogya Kendram health centre.
tool_jak_subtitle: Locate the nearest primary health centre in your area
tool_jak_what_is_description_1: Janakeeya Arogya Kendram (JAK) is Kerala's network of family health centres that provide comprehensive primary healthcare services to communities. These centres are the first point of contact for preventive, promotive, and curative healthcare.
tool_jak_what_is_description_2: JAKs operate under the National Health Mission and offer free consultations, essential medicines, diagnostic services, and referral support.
tool_jak_search_description: Find a Janakeeya Arogya Kendram near you
tool_jak_coming_soon_description: We're working on adding the complete directory of Janakeeya Arogya Kendrams. In the meantime, please contact your local ASHA worker or visit the nearest government health facility for assistance.

tool_jak_phc_description: Go to your nearest Primary Health Centre

tool_jak_bring_1: Aadhaar card or any government ID
tool_jak_cta_description: Take our quick assessment before your visit to understand your risk factors.
assessment_description: Take our 5-minute comprehensive assessment to understand your health risks and get personalized recommendations. Based on the Community-Based Assessment Checklist (CBAC), this tool screens for non-communicable disease risks and early warning signs.
privacy_description: We don't ask for your name, phone number, or any personal identifiers. All calculations happen on your device, and your data never leaves your browser.
privacy_dialog_what_we_dont_collect_desc: Your name, phone number, email, Aadhaar, address, or any other personal identifiers.
privacy_dialog_what_happens_desc: All calculations happen on your device. Your answers are stored temporarily in your browser and are cleared when you restart the assessment.
privacy_dialog_pdf_desc: When you download your summary, it saves directly to your device. We don't see or store it.
disclaimer_dialog_p1: This tool provides general health risk information and is not a medical diagnosis.
disclaimer_dialog_p2: It does not provide treatment advice. The results are for awareness and educational purposes only.
disclaimer_dialog_p3: If you have symptoms, health concerns, or receive a high-risk result, please consult a doctor or visit your nearest health facility for proper evaluation.
footer_disclaimer: This tool provides general health information and is not a medical diagnosis.
footer_consult_advice: Always consult a healthcare professional for medical advice.
footer_copyright: © {{year}} Healthy Life Campaign. All tools are free to use.
footer_awareness: This is a health awareness tool. It does not diagnose disease or prescribe treatment.

step1_age_tooltip: Enter your age in full years
step1_age_helper: Enter your age in full years.
step1_underage_alert: This tool is designed for adults. You can continue, but results may be less relevant.
step2_subtitle: We'll calculate your BMI and check your readings.
step2_height_error_invalid: Please enter a valid height (50-300 cm)
step2_weight_error_invalid: Please enter a valid weight (10-500 kg)

step2_sugar_description: If you know your recent blood sugar reading

step2_sugar_skipped: Skipped — will continue without blood sugar
step2_elevated_warning_description: Your blood pressure or blood sugar is higher than normal. On the next screen, we'll provide guidance on next steps.
advisory_title: We recommend speaking to a doctor
advisory_description: Your entered blood pressure or blood sugar is higher than normal. This tool can't interpret risk scores safely when these are high. Please consult a doctor at your nearest Family Health Centre for further evaluation.
advisory_measurements_description: What you entered in this assessment
advisory_consult_doctor: Consult a doctor at your nearest Family Health Centre
advisory_why_intro: When blood pressure or blood sugar readings are higher than normal, continuing with risk scoring could give misleading results.
advisory_why_bp: For blood pressure: Readings of 140/90 mmHg or higher suggest you should speak with a healthcare provider about management and lifestyle changes.
advisory_why_sugar: For blood sugar: Elevated readings may indicate pre-diabetes or diabetes, which requires proper medical evaluation and testing.
advisory_why_conclusion: This is why we recommend consulting a doctor before continuing with the general risk assessment.
step3_subtitle: This checklist estimates risk. It does not diagnose disease.
step3_card_description: Answer these questions to calculate your CBAC score
step3_waist_instruction_2: Find the midpoint between the top of your hip bone and the bottom of your ribs
step3_waist_instruction_3: Wrap a measuring tape around this point
step3_waist_instruction_4: The tape should be snug but not tight
step3_waist_instruction_5: Read the measurement after breathing out normally
step3_waist_reference_female: Female: Normal ≤80 cm, Elevated 81-90 cm, High >90 cm
step3_waist_reference_male: Male: Normal ≤90 cm, Elevated 91-100 cm, High >100 cm
step3_waist_select_reference: Choose reference chart for waist scoring
step3_waist_select_note: We ask this only to calculate the checklist score.
step3_waist_thresholds: Thresholds: Normal ≤{{low}} cm, Elevated {{lowPlus}}-{{high}} cm, High >{{high}} cm
step3_family_history_label: Family history of diabetes, hypertension, or heart disease?
step3_score_high_note: Score > 4 indicates higher NCD risk. Please consult a doctor for evaluation.
step3_score_low_note: Score ≤ 4 indicates lower risk. Continue with healthy habits.
step3_high_risk_alert_description: Your score suggests higher risk for diabetes or hypertension. We recommend visiting the nearest Janakeeya Arogya Kendram for further evaluation.
step4_consultation_description: Based on your assessment, please visit the nearest Janakeeya Arogya Kendram for further evaluation, or contact your ASHA for assistance.

step4_advice_tobacco: Consider seeking tobacco cessation support; reducing tobacco lowers risk over time.

step4_advice_activity: Aim for at least 150 minutes/week of moderate activity, starting gradually.

step4_tobacco_tip_3: Keep your hands busy with healthy alternatives
step4_tobacco_tip_4: Ask at your nearest JAK about quit programs

step4_alcohol_tip_2: Plan alcohol-free days and stick to them
step4_alcohol_tip_3: Choose smaller portions when you do drink
step4_alcohol_tip_4: Seek de-addiction support if cutting down is difficult
step4_alcohol_support_note: Professional support is available if you find it difficult to reduce on your own.
step4_activity_strength_tip: Add strength: Try simple bodyweight exercises (squats, wall push-ups) 2 days/week for added benefit.
step4_good_track_description: Keep up your healthy habits with regular physical activity, balanced diet, regular check-ups, and stress management.
step4_diet_underweight_2: Include protein sources daily (eggs, dal, milk, fish)
step4_diet_overweight_1: Reduce sugary drinks and processed foods
step4_diet_overweight_2: Fill half your plate with vegetables
step4_sugar_tip_1: Choose whole grains over refined carbs
step4_sugar_tip_3: Don't skip meals; prefer steady meal timing
step4_sugar_tip_4: Consult a doctor for proper testing
step4_activity_sedentary_2: Take short breaks from sitting every hour
step4_activity_adequate_3: Try new activities to stay motivated
step4_download_dialog_description: Generate a beautifully formatted PDF with all your assessment results.
step4_download_privacy_note: The PDF will be saved on your device only. We don't store or see it.
